Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 07:08AM Kimmysu wrote: Windlass--I am almost three weeks out from a bilateral mastectomy with auxillary lymph node dissection in one arm.  I have/had ibc--I think I read you did too?  Yes, I am still in pain, very much like you described, and it gets worse as the day goes on instead of better as I would've expected.  I got off the pain meds for a while but the constant nerve-burning-pain made me crazy, so I am taking half a pill when necessary, and then switching off between tylenol and ibuprofen.   I go in for radiation in a few days and I am so scared because I am still in pain!   Also, I drove a short ways the other day to go for a walk in a park, and I think I over did it because that night I developed seroma (at least I think that's what the swelling is) under my arm and it is making the incisions pull and burn.  Now I am afraid to use my arm for fear of creating more trouble.  This is horrible for me as I am usually very active.   Any advise would be much appreciated. :-)
